document_title: Esophageal cancer: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Esophageal cancer is increasing and rejuvenating, especially in developing countries like Vietnam. Therefore, you should proactively prevent esophageal cancer with the following measures:
Eat moderately, exercise regularly, maintain a weight appropriate to your physical condition;; Limit eating fermented foods, pickled foods, canned and processed foods;; Eat lots of green vegetables and fruits;; Do not use tobacco or alcohol;; Get vaccinated against HPV.
In addition, the US National Cancer Network (NCCN: National Comprehensive Cancer Network) has recommended early esophageal cancer screening with esophagoscopy if there are genetic risk factors such as Barrett's esophageal syndrome. familial dysmenorrhea, Bloom syndrome, Tylosis, Fanconi anemia.

Esophageal cancer has a relatively poor prognosis, because patients are often diagnosed at a late stage. However, if the disease is diagnosed and treated at an early stage, the patient can still be cured. To prevent and detect esophageal cancer early, you should maintain a healthy lifestyle and diet and see a doctor early when you have unusual symptoms.
